diagnosis.final_diagnosis: adenocarcinoma of the cecum with metastases to regional lymph nodes and peritoneum (AJCC stage T4N1M1)
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: small-bowel cancer, appendiceal cancer, metastatic carcinoma from another site (upper gastrointestinal tract, pancreas, bile duct), pseudomyxoma peritonei
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: CT and PET scans showed a mass in the cecum with intense tracer uptake and evidence of peritoneal carcinomatosis and lung metastases. Pathological examination of biopsies confirmed invasive adenocarcinoma, with immunohistochemical analysis arguing against hereditary non-polyposis colorectal cancer (HNPCC) due to intact nuclear staining in tumor cells.
